definition: to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to take over by force/to rob/to plunder/to brush over/to skim/to sweep

sentences.english: Unquestionably, the united army is the chief criminal of the plunder.
sentences.chinese: 英法聯軍無疑是最先搶掠圓明園的罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: the rape of the Sabine women is a case in point.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬人搶掠薩賓族婦女就是最好的例子。

sentences.english: During one of these missions, Smith was captured and seemingly served up for execution.
sentences.chinese: 在一次搶掠中，史密斯被抓住了，眼看就要性命不保。

sentences.english: The marauding rebels of the Lord's Resistance Army no longer haunt this land.
sentences.chinese: 到處搶掠的反叛組織聖主抵抗軍不再在這裏擾民。

sentences.english: Snatching , pickpocketing , and shop thefts all rose.
sentences.chinese: 搶掠扒竊及店鋪盜竊均有所增加。

sentences.english: In the robbery process, eight heavy was going to burn out peoples food can.
sentences.chinese: 在搶掠過程中，八重本來打算燒光百姓的糧食就可。

sentences.english: The invaders burned, killed and looted wherever they went.

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
